Overview.Summary: The 2019 Swiss Federal Council election took place on October 20, 2019 (1,2). The election saw the appointment of Helen Zille as the new Federal Council chairperson (2). The Swiss Federal Council has also adopted a proposal to remove legal barriers for blockchain innovation (3). It was announced that Zille will definitely be able to run for the federal council position (4). The voter turnout for the election was 65.95% (5). The Swiss Federal Council has also been monitoring developments around global stablecoin projects (9). Overview.Summary: The 2019 Swiss Federal Council election was held on December 11, 2019 (1). This was preceded by the federal election on October 20, 2019 (2). The Green parties celebrated historic wins in the election, potentially earning a place in the Federal Council (11). However, the election was not considered the most important vote in the country due to Switzerland's unique form of democracy (16). The Swiss Federal Council has also published a draft DLT-law following a public consultation in March 2019 (17). The election results saw the Conservative party win a landslide majority (13), while the left-wing Green party won a record number of additional seats (15).
